hero.title: Bachata Lab St. Gallen

hero.tagline: RDF Bachata Fusion – Weekly Group Classes

monday.title: Monday – Intermediate (20:30–22:30)
monday.description: We focus on one combination for the whole month. This helps you truly learn the technique, control your body, and dance it with confidence and flow.

thursday.title: Thursday – Beginner + Practice (20:30–22:30)
thursday.part1desc: Learn partnerwork basics, rhythm, body movement, and connection.
thursday.part2desc: Practice in a relaxed space — grow at your own pace.

friday.title: Friday – Open Level (20:30–22:30)
friday.description: Fun drills, partnerwork, musical flow — everyone is welcome!
friday.special: 💡 Every last Friday of the month:
friday.stylingDesc: Styling Class – express yourself and build confidence
friday.socialDesc: Social Practice – just dance, have fun, no pressure

hero.title: About Coach Wil
hero.subtitle: Building strong foundations, clear teaching, and real progress

journey.title: 🎵 My Dance Journey
journey.p1: I've been dancing Latin styles for over 15 years. During COVID, I realized most people learn bachata through partner work first, but real progress comes when you also train your solo foundation — footwork, body movement, arm coordination, timing, and musicality.
journey.p2: I went back to basics, drilling fundamentals repeatedly, and that's when everything started to flow better than I could have expected.

rdf.title: 💻 RDF Bachata Fusion App
rdf.intro: I designed RDF for people like:
rdf.item1: Complete beginners who want to learn correctly from day one
rdf.item2: Shy or unsure dancers who prefer building confidence first
rdf.item3: Experienced dancers who stopped improving and want to rebuild their foundation
rdf.outro: RDF focuses on rhythm, dance, and flow — helping everyone progress at their own pace.

teaching.title: 🏫 Teaching in St. Gallen
teaching.p1: I've spent 4 years teaching in St. Gallen, grateful for every student who trusted me. My partner Sandra joins regularly, helping guide leaders and followers with patience, clarity, and fun.
teaching.p2: Our mission: Strong foundations, clear teaching, real progress, and a supportive community. Bachata Lab is about confidence, connection, fun, and growth.
teaching.p3: Every week, I see strangers become friends, dancers smile, and students gain confidence. That's why I do this.
teaching.p4: Let's practice, have fun, and dance with passion. I'm excited to welcome you to the Bachata Lab family.

questions.question: Do I need a partner to join the classes?
questions.answer: No partner is required! We rotate partners during class so you get to dance with different people. This also helps you learn faster and makes the class more social.

questions.question: I've never danced before — can I still join?
questions.answer: Absolutely. Our Thursday beginner class is designed for complete newcomers. We focus on fundamentals, rhythm, and connection so you can build confidence step by step.

questions.question: How long until I can dance socially?
questions.answer: That depends on you and how often you practice. For instance, many students feel comfortable dancing socially after one month of consistent training — especially with the extra support from the RDF Bachata Fusion App.

questions.question: What should I wear to class?
questions.answer: Comfortable clothes and indoor shoes (or socks with grip). Bring water to stay hydrated. No special outfit is required — just come ready to move and have fun!

questions.question: How do I practice outside of class?
questions.answer: You'll have access to practice sessions, plus the RDF Bachata Fusion App, where you can review class material, work on drills, and follow challenges to progress from home.

questions.question: Why is membership better than paying per class?
questions.answer: Memberships give you more for less. Instead of paying class by class, you get flexible access to weekly classes, app support, and party passes — making it easier to practice consistently, save money, and truly grow as a dancer.

questions.question: Is bachata good for fitness and social life?
questions.answer: Yes! Bachata helps with body coordination, musicality, and confidence — while also being a fun way to meet new people and connect in a friendly community.

outro.title: Still have questions?
outro.description:
Feel free to reach out to Coach Wil directly.
We're here to help you start your bachata journey!
